title: Drawing, "Cartoon for cotton printing: "Le Tombeau de Jean-Jacques Rousseau a Ermenonville."", after 1780
title_raw: Cartoon for cotton printing: "Le Tombeau de Jean-Jacques Rousseau a Ermenonville."
medium: Pen and ink with grey washes on cream-colored paper (mounted)
description: Three registers of vignettes including a chinois summer house, a windmill, a thatched cottage, ruins of a circular classical temple adorned with statuary, women hanging up laundry to dry, the tomb of the literateur, Jean-Jacques Rousseau (1712-1778), situated on a small island, children being instructed, barnyard animals and figures at a fountain.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Cartoon for cotton printing: "Le Tombeau de Jean-Jacques Rousseau a Ermenonville."", after 1780. Pen and ink with grey washes on cream-colored paper (mounted). Gift of Bridget Mahon. 1898-21-8.
